pageContext.title: South Bonnieview Boat Launch
pageContext.content:
Also known as the John F Reginato River Access, Mr. Reginato oversaw the Shasta-Cascade Wonderland Assn. which promoted tourism and recreation in the N. California. Starting in 1949, he was at the job for 41 years. A visionary of sorts, he was influential in introducing “house boating” to the West by promoting “campers with pontoons” on Shasta Lake more than 50 years ago.

Although most of the “guide lingo” on the Lower Sacramento river refers to the South Bonnieview Boat Launch as “Bonnie” for short, John F Reginato can’t go without mention.

“Bonnie” is located about 5 miles downriver of the Posse Grounds boat ramp making it almost perfect for a float that can last all day or just 4 hours. As much as Bonnie is a great take out spot for anglers drifting from the Posse Grounds, The South Bonnieview Boat Launch is a great starting point for floats down to Anderson River park or Balls Ferry boat ramp.

South Bonnieview Boat Launch offers a large parking area, restrooms and it’s conveniently located just across the Lower Sacramento River from the Hilton Garden Inn.

Bonnie is positioned on the southern end of Redding near Interstate 5. Restaurants and additional accommodations are no more than 5 ~ 15 minutes away.

Getting there:

Exiting Interstate 5 at the South Bonnieview Rd from the north or Churn Creek Rd approaching from the south, head west across the Lower Sacramento River. Be prepared to make a left turn at the light just past the river at Indianwood Dr.

Find South Bonnieview Boat Launch: Map
